This code system http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0544 defines the following codes:

XAMB Not Ambient temperatureNot Ambient temperatureFailed to keep at ambient (room) temperature, approximately 22 +/- 2 degrees C. Accidental refrigeration or freezing is of little consequenceFailed to keep at ambient (room) temperature, approximately 22 +/- 2 degrees C. Accidental refrigeration or freezing is of little consequence
XCAMB Not Critical ambient temperatureNot Critical ambient temperatureFailed to keep critical ambient.Failed to keep critical ambient.
XREF Not Refrigerated temperatureNot Refrigerated temperatureFailed to keep at refrigerated temperature: 4-8 degrees C.Failed to keep at refrigerated temperature: 4-8 degrees C.
XCREF Not Critical refrigerated temperatureNot Critical refrigerated temperatureFailed to keep critical refrigerated.Failed to keep critical refrigerated.
XFRZ Not Frozen temperatureNot Frozen temperatureFailed to keep at frozen temperature: -4 degrees C.Failed to keep at frozen temperature: -4 degrees C.
XCFRZ Not Critical frozen temperatureNot Critical frozen temperatureFailed to keep critical frozenFailed to keep critical frozen
XDFRZ Not Deep frozenNot Deep frozenFailed to keep deep frozen: -16 to -20 degree C.Failed to keep deep frozen: -16 to -20 degree C.
XUFRZ Not Ultra frozenNot Ultra frozenFailed to keep ultra cold frozen: ~ -75 to -85 degree C. (ultra cold freezer is typically at temperature of dry ice).Failed to keep ultra cold frozen: ~ -75 to -85 degree C. (ultra cold freezer is typically at temperature of dry ice).
XNTR Not Liquid nitrogenNot Liquid nitrogenFailed to keep in liquid nitrogen.Failed to keep in liquid nitrogen.
XPRTL Not Protected from lightNot Protected from lightFailed to protect from light.Failed to protect from light.
XCATM Exposed to AirExposed to AirExposed to atmosphere.Exposed to atmosphere.
XDRY Not DryNot DryFailed to keep in a dry environment.Failed to keep in a dry environment.
XPSO Exposed to shockExposed to shockFailed to protect from shock.Failed to protect from shock.
XPSA ShakenShakenShaken.Shaken.
XUPR Not UprightNot UprightFailed to keep upright.Failed to keep upright.
XMTLF Metal ExposedMetal ExposedFailed to keep container is free of heavy metals.Failed to keep container is free of heavy metals.

name: ContainerCondition
title: containerCondition
description: HL7-defined  code system of concepts used to specify at each receipt the status of the container in which the specimen is shipped in chain of custody cases where specimens are moved from lab to lab.  If the container is compromised in any way (seal broken, container cracked or leaking, etc.), then this status needs to be recorded for legal reasons.  Used in the Specimen (SPM), Shipment (SHP) and Shipment Package (PAC) segments in HL7 Version 2.x messaging.
purpose: Underlying Master Code System for V2 table 0544 (Container Condition)
copyright: Copyright HL7. Licensed under creative commons public domain
